Clinical: Apoplexy. Asthma millari. Bones, affections of. Chemosis. Dysphagia. Eyes, affections of. Hernia. Intermittent fever. Liver-spots. Lupus. Pterygium. Ptosis. Tongue, affections of. Tonsils, swollen. Vertigo. Whooping-cough.
Characteristics: Petroz is the authority for this drug, which produces a number of symptoms in the eyes, and cases of chemosis and pterygium have been reported cured with it. R. K. Ghosh (H. R., viii. 459) cured a number of cases of both. He found a lotion of Guarea O (gtt i. to one drachm) of great assistance. In the head there is a sensation as if the brain were falling forward; and a sensation as of a blow on the head leaving numbness and diminished thinking power. The eye symptoms alternate with diminished hearing. A number of symptoms were experienced in the umbilicus and inguinal rings. Flow of blood between menses. Pains in periosteum. On the skin there were liver-spots, and an eruption with burning vesicles. Sleepy in open air. Aromatic-smelling sweat. Sensations of constriction are common. Sudden shocks of whole body. Bruised pains. Acids and cold water <; hot drinks, and wrapping warmly >. Sweat when eating or after. Bone pains < at night.
Relations: Bov. (flow of blood between menses); Crotal. (as if had a blow on the head); Anac. (peg in ear); Gels. (vertigo, ptosis); Azadiracta indica (botan.) Apis (chemosis, asthma millari); Arn. (injuries); Phos. (steatoma) Ign. (nerves); Merc. and Silic. (bone-pains, suppuration).
Head: Vertigo; when stooping; objects appear upside down.
Whirling dizziness.
Sensation as if the brain were falling forward.
Sensation as if from blow on the head, leaving a kind of numbness and diminished thinking power; as after apoplectic seizure.
Constriction, heaviness, shocks; in forehead.
Constriction, hammering in occiput.
Eyes: Sickly look round eyes and within orbits.
Inflammation of conjunctiva, which is swollen.
Pain in ball as after weeping.
Tearing pain in eyeballs; tension; forced-out feeling.
Objects appear grey; during vertigo they appear upside down.
Eye symptoms alternate with diminution of hearing.
Ears: Sensation in ears as of a peg; of a worm; pushing-out feeling.
Nose: Coryza; with hardened secretion; with heat.
Nose stuffed; ineffectual desire to sneeze; constriction at root of nose.
Teeth and Mouth: Pains in teeth accompanied by pain in zygoma, excited by draught of air, by pressure of tongue; < lying on painful side; by hot food; by walking.
Tongue coated greyish yellow; swollen; paralysed; bleeding.
Throat: Oesophagus: raw pain; sensation of contraction and burning heat.
Appetite: Canine hunger in evening; speedy satiety.
Aversion to milk, fish, and hot, greasy, cooked food.
Stomach: Sour eructations with tension and pressure at stomach.
Stomach: constriction in; bruised feeling in.
Abdomen: Abdomen distended with lancination in groins and inguinal ring.
Female Sexual Organs: Flow of blood between menstrual periods.
Respiratory Organs: Cough: dry barking; violent deep-seated; with expectoration.
The cough is accompanied by sweat, pain, soreness, tightness of chest; comes after a crying spell; on falling asleep; after getting chilled; is excited by itching in throat, by irritation in larynx.
Sensation of hollowness and dilatation of chest.
Respiratory symptoms < from putting hand to throat.
Generalities: Steatoma; hot swelling; swelling of affected parts.
Sleep: Dreams, anxious, melancholy, full of strife.
Fever: Coldness followed by heat with sweat.
Heat of upper part of body, coldness of bones.
Sweat chiefly during and after eating.
